Patent Information.Patent Title: Anti-endotoxic antimicrobial cationic peptides and methods of use therfor.
Patent Information.Abstract: A novel class of cationic peptides having antimicrobial activity is provided. Exemplary peptides of the invention include KWKSFIKKLTSAAKKVVTTAKPLALIS (SEQ ID NO:3) and KGWGSFFKKAAHVGKHVGKAALTHYL (SEQ ID NO:15). Also provided are methods for inhibiting the growth of bacteria utilizing the peptides of the invention. Such methods are useful for the treatment of respiratory infections, such as in cystic fibrosis patients. Such methods are further useful for accelerating wound healing.

Sequence Information.Target Organism: [Swiss_Prot Entry P36191]Female-specific peptides with potent activity against Gram-positive and Gram-negative bacteria
Sequence Information.Function: Female-specific peptides with potent activity against Gram-positive and Gram-negative bacteria. They have as well hemolytic activity.
Sequence Information.Temperature dependence: Thermostable. Still active at 100 degrees Celsius.

Literature.Title: Purification and primary structure of ceratotoxin A and B, two antibacterial peptides from the female reproductive accessory glands of the medfly Ceratitis capitata (InsectaDiptera).
Literature.Author: Marchini D, Giordano PC, Amons R, Bernini LF, Dallai R.

Literature.Title: Purification and primary structure of ceratotoxin A and B, two antibacterial peptides from the female reproductive accessory glands of the medfly Ceratitis capitata (Insecta: Diptera).
